DataElement.definition: The term which describes the method used to maintain the specimen in a viable state.
DataElement.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElement.changeDescription: 3/21/22 mr Released per SME.   2/25/22 mr Awaiting SME review.   2/7/22 mr Created for MCL BIospecimen per DCT.

DataElementConcept.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.
DataElementConcept.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/21/22 mr Released per SME.   2/3/22 jk created for MCL Biospecimen data set.
DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 7/11/25 Corrected DEC from Biospecimen to Specimen. mr;

ObjectClass.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.definition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.

Concepts.definition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.

ConceptualDomain.definition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.definition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
ValueDomain.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/21/22 mr Released per SME.   2/7/22 mr Created for MCL Biospecimen per DCT.

ValueMeaning.definition: Tissue which has not been exposed to a fixative solution.

Concepts.definition: Tissue which has not been exposed to a fixative solution.

PermissibleValues.value: Fresh Dissociated and Single Cell Sorted into Plates
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Fresh Dissociated Tissue Preparation, Single Cell Sorted into Plates

ValueMeaning.longName: Fresh Dissociated Tissue Preparation, Single Cell Sorted into Plates
ValueMeaning.definition: A tissue preparation process that takes dissociated, sorted cells and distributes them into cell propagation plates.

Concepts.longName: Fresh Dissociated Tissue Preparation, Single Cell Sorted into Plates
Concepts.definition: A tissue preparation process that takes dissociated, sorted cells and distributes them into cell propagation plates.

PermissibleValues.value: Fresh Dissociated and Single Cell Sorted
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Fresh Dissociated Tissue Preparation, Single Cell Sorted

ValueMeaning.longName: Fresh Dissociated Tissue Preparation, Single Cell Sorted
ValueMeaning.definition: A tissue preparation process that separates fresh dissociated tissue cells into cell populations by single cell sorting.

Concepts.longName: Fresh Dissociated Tissue Preparation, Single Cell Sorted
Concepts.definition: A tissue preparation process that separates fresh dissociated tissue cells into cell populations by single cell sorting.

ValueMeaning.definition: A tissue preparation process that takes fresh tissue and dissociates it into single cell suspensions.

Concepts.definition: A tissue preparation process that takes fresh tissue and dissociates it into single cell suspensions.

ValueMeaning.definition: Preservation of cells, tissues, organs, or embryos by storage at low temperatures.

Concepts.definition: Preservation of cells, tissues, organs, or embryos by storage at low temperatures.

ValueMeaning.definition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 3/4/25 Added alt VM names per RFC 26 CR 1. sl

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.definition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

Concepts.definition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

ValueMeaning.definition: To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation.

Concepts.definition: To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation.

ValueMeaning.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.definition: A microscope slide prepared by depositing cells directly onto a slide by centrifugation. The cytocentrifuge spins at an angle, at low speeds, allowing the cells to adhere to the slide in a monolayer format.

Concepts.definition: A microscope slide prepared by depositing cells directly onto a slide by centrifugation. The cytocentrifuge spins at an angle, at low speeds, allowing the cells to adhere to the slide in a monolayer format.

ValueMeaning.definition: A device designed to maintain a vacuum at a below-ambient temperature.

Concepts.definition: A device designed to maintain a vacuum at a below-ambient temperature.

ValueMeaning.definition: A specimen that has been kept or preserved at a low temperature in a refrigerator.

Concepts.definition: A specimen that has been kept or preserved at a low temperature in a refrigerator.

ValueMeaning.definition: The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity.

Concepts.definition: The chemical preservation of a substance to maintain structural and/or molecular features of that substance as they exist in the living entity.

ConceptualDomain.definition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.definition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Procedures utilized to save substances from decay. Some preservation procedures are meant to maintain cells, tissues, or organisms in a viable state.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.documentText: Method used to preserve the sample
